page.title: 12Tourism(2)-Broughton/Holt
page.content: CHURCHES Within this area are two churches of artitectural interest. All Saints-Chalfield The little Parish Church of All Saints adjoins the forecourt of Chalfield Manor. Parts of the nave, which was enlarged by Thomas Tropnell in the 15th.c., date from the 14th.c.. Tropnell also rebuilt the chancel and added the hood which forms the porch to the west door. A large buttress was added against the north wall in 1719 and in 1775 the vestry was added. The earliest records refer to institutions to a chapel in 1316 and a church in 1349.
